content:
Diagnosis:
Pancreatic glucagonoma with liver metastases

Initial Presentation:
Diagnosed January 2024 following investigation of necrolytic migratory erythema and diabetes. Initial glucagon 455 pmol/L, Chromogranin A 890 ng/mL.

Previous Treatment:
Lanreotide 120mg monthly commenced February 2024
Cycle 1-2 Capecitabine/Temozolomide March-April 2024

Current Status:
Pre cycle 3 CAPTEM review

Current Symptoms:
Necrolytic migratory erythema improved
Diabetes stable on insulin
Grade 1 hand-foot syndrome
Mild fatigue

Bloods:
Glucagon decreased to 280 pmol/L
CgA trending down to 456 ng/mL
FBC/LFTs/U&Es satisfactory for cycle 3

Imaging:
MRI liver 15/04/2024 shows partial response with reduction in size of largest liver metastasis from 3.2cm to 2.1cm

Performance Status:
ECOG PS 1

Plan:
Proceed with cycle 3 CAPTEM today
Continue monthly Lanreotide
Repeat biochemical markers in 3 weeks
MRI liver after cycle 4
Review in clinic prior to cycle 4
